Februar 2017) 63.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Adarabioyo playing for [[Manchester City F.C. EDS and Academy|Manchester City Reserves]] in 2017 | fullname = Abdul-Nasir Oluwatosin Oluwadoyinsolami Adarabioyo{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/-/media/files/thefaportal/governance-docs/registrations/september-2014.ashx |title=List of Players under Written Contract Registered Between 01/09/2014 and 30/09/2014 |publisher=The Football Association |format=PDF |page=1 |accessdate=16 February 2019}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|9|24|df=y}}{{cite web |title=UEFA Youth League - Tosin Adarabioyo |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefayouthleague/season=2015/clubs/player=250064355/index.html |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=22 February 2016}} | birth_place = [[Manchester]], England | height = {{height|ft=6|in=5}}{{cite news |first=Rick |last=Kelsey |title=Who's that playing for Manchester City? Team fields five debutants |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/35630142/whos-that-playing-for-manchester-city-team-fields-five-debutants |publisher=BBC Newsbeat |date=22 February 2016 |accessdate=30 March 2016}} | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]]
(on loan from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]) | clubnumber = 24 | youthclubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | youthyears1 = 2003–2016 | clubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | years1 = 2016– | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | clubs2 = → [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] (loan) | years2 = 2018– | caps2 = 19 | goals2 = 0 | club-update = 23:08, 14 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalyears1 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2013 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 3 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 6 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2015 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 1 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalteam-update = }} '''Abdul-Nasir Oluwatosin Oluwadoyinsolami Adarabioyo''' (born 24 September 1997) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on loan from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. ==Club career== Adarabioyo joined the youth system at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] aged five.{{cite news|author= |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-one-to-watch-tosin-adarabioyo-8650768 |title=Man City one-to-watch: Tosin Adarabioyo – I'll do anything to win |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=17 February 2015 |accessdate=30 March 2016}} He made his U18 debut for the club aged 14 and was captaining the U18s aged 16.{{cite web |url=https://www.mcfc.co.uk/teams/eds/defenders/tosin-adarabioyo |title=Manchester City Academy defender Tosin Adarabioyo |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |accessdate=25 February 2016}} On 21 February 2016, Adarabioyo made his [[first-team]] debut in an [[FA Cup]] match against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/MCFC/status/701421127520882689 |title=Manchester City FC on Twitter: "TEAM NEWS: Full debuts given to five players today! Congrats, lads! #chelseavcity #facup #mcfc" |publisher=Twitter |date=21 February 2016 |accessdate=25 February 2016}} He made his [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] debut on 24 August 2016 as a substitute in a 1–0 win over [[CSA Steaua București|Steaua București]], in a Champions League [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round|play-off round]] match.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/report?gameId=462997|title=Man City advance to UCL group stage with defeat of Steaua Bucharest|date=24 August 2016|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=6 November 2016}} Adarabioyo joined [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on loan for the 2018–19 season.{{cite web |title=Albion swoop for Man City prospect |url=https://www.wba.co.uk/news/2018/august/albion-swoop-for-city-prospect/ |publisher=West Bromwich Albion|accessdate=3 August 2018}} ==International career== Adarabioyo has represented [[England national football team|England]] up to U19 level.{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2015/nov/tosin-adarabioyo-previews-england-u19s-v-japan-in-manchester-101115 |title=Tosin Adarabioyo relishing chance to pull on the Three Lions in front of his fellow Mancunians on Sunday - England |publisher=The Football Association |date=10 November 2015 |accessdate=25 February 2016}} ==Personal life== Adarabioyo was born in England and is of Nigerian descent.{{cite web|url=http://www.allnigeriasoccer.com/read_news.php?nid=21307|title=Man City Whizkid Tosin Adarabioyo Turns Down Chance To Play For Nigeria:: All Nigeria Soccer - The Complete Nigerian Football Portal|website=www.allnigeriasoccer.com}} Tosin is the brother of [[Fisayo Adarabioyo]], who is a free agent after being released by [[NAC Breda]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3738715/Manchester-City-s-starting-XI-Pep-Guardiola-era-set-include-Tosin-Adarabioyo-unknown-academy-graduate.html |title=Manchester City youngster Tosin Adarabioyo in the first team picture... but who is the academy graduate? |date=13 August 2016 |accessdate=1 September 2016 |work=Daily Mail}}{{cite web |url=http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:vjsn-2eU2KYJ:m.mcfc.co.uk/%3Fi%3D12321/1/0%26artId%3D536969+&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=uk |title=News - Academy News |date=3 September 2014 |accessdate=1 September 2016 |work=Manchester City F.C. }}{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite web|url=http://www.sl10.ng/news/articles/categories/nigeria-players-abroad/crystal-palace-snap-up-ex-manchester-city-starlet-fisayo-adarabioyo/180370 |title=Palace Snap Up Ex-Man City Starlet Adarabioyo |date=22 October 2014 |accessdate=1 September 2016 |work=sl10.ng}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|5 January 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/oluwatosin-tosin-adarabioyo/317349/|title=T.
